title: (x) Gentleman's Choice - Hogarth {Mike Y}
content:
can anyone help me to identify this typeface below, please?   
Thx in advance   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071210203849im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/43163.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Sri Lanka Airlines - custom typeface {Richard}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071210203849/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6285 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Slab serif font - various {gang} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071210203849/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6276 "Go to next forum topic")
author: case

comments.content:
It looks like a Victorian typeface called 'Hogarth', as seen in the Dover book of Victorian Display Alphabets by Dan X. Solo. Apparently it is one of the fonts included in the Dover "Victorian" Fonts CD made with fonts provided by Dan Solo.   
   
If you need evidence to support this I can scan the showing from the book.
BTW, the listing I have of the Dover Font CD contents (courtesy of Mark Johannson) is the reason I stated that it is on that CD.

Here is a sample of Hogarth as scanned from the above-mentioned book.   
 ![Hogarth sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20071210203849im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47184.gif)
